article.headline: Harvard 78, Yale 71
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Kevin Rogus scored 22 points and Matt Stehle added 13 points and nine rebounds Saturday as Harvard beat Yale 78-71. The loss snapped a six game losing streak for the Crimson (3-18, 2-6 Ivy League). Edwin Draughan led Yale (9-12, 4-4) with 21 points. Alex Gamboa scored 15 points and Sam Kaplan 12 as the Bulldogs' three-game winning streak ended. Stehle's layup 3:22 into the second half gave the Crimson their biggest lead of the night at 46-36. But Yale answered with a 18-5 run, including 10 points from Draughan to take a 54-51 lead with 11:10 remaining. The two teams traded baskets over the next eight minutes before Rogus made a 3-pointer with 3:28 left to put Harvard ahead 68-67 and Yale never regained the lead again. Harvard held Yale to 10-of-31 shooting from the field and forced six turnovers as they led 35-30 at halftime.
